III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10107- Employment Policies and Procedures;
Section Establishment
Description (1) A facility shall establish and follow written employment policies
and procedures that shall assure that staff are emotionally stable
and of suitable health, ability, experience, and education to
perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth and staff member are involved in a relationship with one
another. They are trying to keep this secret until the youth
completes the program.
Investigation Interviews:
Probation Officer was interviewed via phone on March 6,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Probation Officer
reported Youth A is on her caseload. She reported she was
transporting another youth on her caseload somewhere, where
this youth told her that Youth A was face timing with Staff 1 during
her home pass from the program. This youth (identifying
information was unable to be obtained) reported Youth A is
keeping her relationship with Staff 1 on the “down low” until she is
discharged from the facility. Probation Officer denied talking to
Youth A about these reported allegations but talked with Mother
about these concerns. She reported Youth A was on a home pass
from February 21- 23, 2025. Mother reported Youth A was on the
phone often during the visit and did not have concerns about who
she was talking to. Probation Officer reported that Mother reported
Youth A has expressed Staff 1 is her favorite staff member and
has a crush on him. Probation Officer reported Youth A does have
a sexualized history and has been with older men before. When
asked about reporting these concerns, she reported she told
someone at Ottawa County Court of these concerns who was
going to report it to the facility. She reported on Monday, February
3, 2025, that person told her if she had concerns of abuse and
neglect, she should make a report as she has first-hand
knowledge.
Youth A was interviewed face to face by Law Enforcement at
the police department on March 7, 2025, this Consultant and
MDHHS Worker watched the interview occur. Youth A reported
she was discharged from the facility today due to completing her
programming. She reported she did not get along with the staff at
the facility because they were quick to give a consequence to the
youth. Youth A reported she did get along more with the male staff
than the female staff, which she reported is normal for her
2

because she is close with her grandfather. She reported Staff 1
was one of her main support people at the facility and he would
help her with her impulse control. When asked to explain more
about this, Youth A reported Staff 1 would talk with her and
provide her with worksheets to help calm her down. Youth A
stated she would either talk with him one-on-one in the conference
room that is near the control center or through her door when she
was in her room. She reported there was never anything
inappropriate talked about and staff can see and hear in the
recorded conference room. When asked to explain what they
talked about, she reported Staff 1 always encouraged her to do
well and stay positive. Youth A reported Staff 1 and the other male
staff do not really work on her unit because it is an all-female unit,
and the other female youth were pushing their boundaries with the
male staff. She reported she has never seen any boundary
concerns before between staff and youth at the facility. Youth A
reported she never felt uncomfortable at the facility. She reported
she has gone on home visits but never talked to Staff 1 outside of
the facility. Youth A reported she never exchanged social media
information or phone numbers with Staff 1. She reported there is
no way to communicate with staff outside of the facility as it is
against the rules. When asked why someone would bring up
concerns about her talking with Staff 1, Youth A reported she had
no idea and noted they just had a good bond. She reported there
was a point where he was not allowed to talk to her one-on-one
anymore because she continued to only ask for him. Youth A
reported she has never had any physical contact with Staff 1 as
they are not allowed to fist bump, high five, or hug at the facility.
Youth A confirmed when she was at the facility she stayed on C
pod.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
21, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Law
Enforcement. Staff 1 reported he has been working at the facility
for about a year. He reported he is currently in his master’s
program to become a therapist. Staff 1 reported he is a support
staff to many of the youth at the facility, which means he will
process one-on-one with them about how they are feeling or de-
escalate a youth when they are upset. He reported he is trained to
always meet with a youth where he is in the video of the camera
and is being audio recorded. Staff 1 reported he primarily works
on the male units and does not go onto C pod due to it being
primarily female. He reported he is aware of Youth A as she would
always ask to process with him. Staff 1 reported one day Youth A
was crying in the small conference room and someone had asked
him to process with her because he has a positive relationship
3

with the youth. He reported he met with her in the small
conference room as this room is right next to the control center
and is on video and audio recording. Staff 1 reported since that
meeting, Youth A continued to always ask to meet with him. He
reported he never treated Youth A any differently than any of the
other youth. Staff 1 reported he would bring in worksheets for her
to complete like he did the other youth, which would help process
feelings and work on coping skills. He reported Staff 2 did inform
him that Youth A may have a crush on him and with that
information, he made sure to be mindful of keeping appropriate
boundaries. Staff 1 reported when Youth A first got to the facility,
she had poor boundaries and would ask staff inappropriate
questions. He reported he had to remind Youth A to keep an arm's
length of space between her and any staff. Staff 1 reported staff
are not allowed to have any personal touch with the youth which
includes hugs, high fives, and fist bumps. He denied ever
speaking with youth from the facility on social media or on the
phone when they were discharged or on a home pass. Staff 1
reported he is trained that staff are not to share personal
information, including social media information with the youth. He
reported he did hear a rumor before that Youth A had asked Youth
C to ask Staff 1 for his social media information and a staff
member intervened on this, but he could not remember who that
was. When asked if there was anything else about Youth A, he
reported one time he contacted Youth A’s Mother due to Youth A
having punched the wall. Staff 1 reported when he spoke with
Youth A’s Mother, she reported Youth A is always talking so highly
of him and having a positive relationship with him. He reported
Youth A’s Mother then asked him about his father and believed
she dated him. Staff 1 reported it was a strange conversation, and
he did not confirm this information with Youth A’s Mother. He
reported he did talk with Supervisor after this phone call to make
sure this information was provided to the facility. Staff 1 denied
ever having any contact with Youth A outside the facility and
denied being in a relationship with Youth A. He reported he would
never have any contact with a youth outside of the facility and if a
youth was attempting to contact him outside the facility he would
report it immediately to Supervisor.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
March 21, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor reported he works very closely with Staff 1 and
reported he is a great staff member. He reported he is aware of
Youth A and noted that she was a very vocal youth. Supervisor
reported Youth A did have a boundary issue due to her past
trauma and reported staff are trained to maintain appropriate
4

boundaries. He reported Youth A was in C pod, which is where all
female youth are housed, and they try to only have female staff on
the unit. Supervisor reported Staff 1 is a very therapeutic staff that
helps youth calm down and think outside the box. He reported
Staff 1 has processed with Youth A before but always made sure
he was in view of the camera and audio recorded. Supervisor
reported that Youth A appeared to have a crush on Staff 1 and the
team was all made aware of this because Youth A would continue
to ask to talk with Staff 1. He reported that he spoke with Staff 1
about this and made sure Staff 1 maintained appropriate
boundaries. Supervisor reported Staff 1 did talk to him about
Youth A’s mother and she may have dated his father in the past
but is uncertain as he did not have a strong relationship with his
father. He reported he does not remember how Staff 1 found out
this information. Supervisor reported he never saw or heard
anything about Staff 1 having inappropriate boundaries with any
youth, including Youth A. He reported staff are trained to not share
personal information with the youth and noted that staff should
never allow youth access to their personal media. Supervisor
reported staff are not allowed to have contact with youth post-
discharge.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
21, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported he is currently in C pod at the facility and was there when
Youth A was at the facility. He reported mostly female staff work
on this unit due to the unit being mostly female youth. Youth B
reported some of the female youth can be “boy crazy”, including
Youth A, and that is why male staff do not work on the unit. He
confirmed Staff 1 does not come on C pod but will come be a
support staff to the youth that need to process their emotions.
Youth B reported there were no concerns to note about
inappropriate boundaries between Staff 1 and any of the youth,
including Youth A. He confirmed that staff are not allowed to share
their personal information, including social media information with
the youth. Youth B reported staff are not allowed to connect with
the youth when they are on home visits or discharged from the
facility. He reported he does not have any concerns about any
staff being in any relationship with the youth that were at the
facility.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
21, 2025. Youth C reported she is currently in C pod and was
placed there when Youth A was there. She reported Youth A had
a crush on Staff 1. When asked to explain more, Youth C reported
Youth A would go around stating that Staff 1 was “her man”. She
5

reported Staff 1 never gave any attention to Youth A and Youth A
just had a crush on him. Youth C reported Youth A would always
ask for Staff 1 to talk to her and Staff 1 would sometimes just
ignore her. She reported Staff 1 never provided any special
treatment to Youth A. Youth C denied Youth A ever asking her to
ask Staff 1 for his social media information. She reported staff are
not allowed to share their personal information with the youth and
are not allowed to have contact with the youth when they leave
the facility. Youth C did not have any concerns about staff having
any inappropriate relationship with the youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
21, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported
she primarily works on C pod with the female youth. She reported
the facility ties to just having a majority of female staff work on that
unit due to it being most female youth on the pod. Staff 2 reported
she was working with Youth A and was placed in this pod. She
reported Youth A was very outspoken and had some personal
boundary issues when she first arrived at the facility. Staff 2
reported Youth A always wanted to know personal information
about the staff and would have to be reminded of personal space.
She reported Youth A always wanted to speak with Staff 1 to
process her feelings. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 is working in
schooling to become a therapist and has a good rapport with the
unit to process their feelings. She reported when a youth needed
to process something, Staff 1 would take the time to meet with
them in the small conference room and help the youth think
outside the box. Staff 2 confirmed the small conference room has
open windows for other staff to see in and is camera and audio
recorded. She reported she heard from other youth on the pod
that Youth A had a crush on Staff 1. Staff 2 reported she gave a
heads-up to Staff 1 about the reports of Youth A having a crush on
him and he took that information seriously. She denied having any
concerns about Staff 1 crossing any boundaries with Youth A and
was always meeting with her in video-recorded areas. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 treated Youth A like she does all the other youth.
She reported staff are not allowed to share personal information,
including social media information, with the youth at the facility.
Staff 2 reported staff are not allowed to have contact with the
youth post-discharge or when the youth is on home pass. She
reported staff are trained to maintain appropriate boundaries.
Mother was interviewed via phone on March 27, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Mother reported she does
not remember speaking to Staff 1 on the phone. She reported she
is not fully aware of who Staff 1 is and is only aware of his name
6

from Youth A speaking about him a few days before her discharge
from the facility. Mother reported Youth A just talked about how
good-looking Staff 1 is. Mother reported Youth A has made
statements to her about having a crush on Staff 1. She reported
she redirected Youth A about this being inappropriate. Mother
reported Youth A has a history of having a crush on older men.
She reported she has never had any concerns about Youth A
speaking on the phone to Staff 1. Mother reported Youth A has
not brought up Staff 1 since she was discharged from the facility.
Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 were interviewed
together face to face at the facility on March 7, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator 1 and
Administrator 2 reported Youth A has been at the facility for over
three months now and was discharged home today. They reported
Youth A has been within their treatment program and has a long
history of concerns about human trafficking and substance use
concerns. Staff were all made aware of these concerns when
Youth A moved to the facility. Administrator 1 and Administrator 2
reported there have been no concerns noted between Staff 1 and
Youth A. Administrator 1 reported since he was made aware of
the concerns, Staff 1 has not been on Youth A’s unit. He reported
when Supervisor was told to kept Staff 1 off that unit, Staff 1
commented to Supervisor about if this had to do with him being
related to Youth A. Administrator 1 reported he is unaware of
Youth A and Staff 1 being related. Administrator 2 reported there
have been no disclosures to her of any concerns of Staff 1 having
inappropriate boundaries with any of the youth. Administrator 1
and Administrator 2 reported in the recent team meeting that they
did a reminder with staff about the Code of Ethics. They reported
they try to keep the male staff off the female unit as much as they
can.
Law Enforcement was interviewed face to face at the facility
on March 21, 2025. Law Enforcement reported due to denial from
Youth A and lack of evidence this case would be closed out.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Code of Ethics Policy with last revision date of
12/20/2024- Within this policy it states, “Staff members will
not seek, encourage, or engage in any relationship or
communication with residents (or former residents) which is
not directly related to their normally assigned duties,
whether in the facility or out, without first receiving the
authorization of the Superintendent.” The policy also
7

prohibits staff behavior to include post release relationships
between staff and juveniles.
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 has been
employed at the facility since April 2024. He has one
written warning noted within his HR File from November
2024 where he was found leaving his keys unattended.
Staff 1 has completed all required trainings and completed
a review of all policies and procedures at the facility on May
1, 2024, and completed PREA training on December
22,2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance within the rule as there was no
evidence found to support Youth A and Staff 1 being in an
inappropriate relationship. Within the interviews of both Youth A
and Staff 1, they both denied having any inappropriate boundaries
or communication outside of the facility. Collateral interviews also
report Staff 1 maintained appropriate boundaries with the youth
and it was reported Youth A had a crush on Staff 1.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
